data.title: Elections: Bulgarian Presidency 2001 Round 1
data.text:
At stake in this election:

The office of President of Bulgaria

Description of government structure:

Chief of State: President Petar STOYANOV

Head of Government: Prime Minister Simeon SAX-COBURG-GOTHA

Assembly: Bulgaria has a unicameral National Assembly (Narodno Sobranie) with 240 seats.

Description of electoral system:

The President is elected by absolute majority vote through a two-round system to serve a 5-year term.

The Prime Minister is elected by parliament.

In the National Assembly (Narodno Sobranie) 240 members are elected through a closed-list proportional representation system to serve 4-year terms.

Main Candidates in the First Round of the Presidential race:

Georgi PURVANOV*

Party: Bulgarian Socialist Party

Petar STOYANOV*

Party: Independent Candidate

Bogomil BONEV

Party: Civil Party for Bulgaria

Reneta INDZHOVA

Party: Movement for Rights and Freedoms'

George GANCHEV

Party: Independent Candidate

Petur BERON

Party: Independent Candidate

*Georgi Purvanov and Peter STOYANOV advanced to the second round of the presidential election.

Last Presidential election:

Presidential elections were last held on October 27 and November 3, 1996. Petar STOYANOV received 59.73% of the vote.

Population and number of registered voters:

Population: 7,796,694 (July 2000 est.)

Registered Voters: 6,868,371 ( 2001 )

Gender Data:

· Female Population: 4,114,100 (2001)

· Has Bulgaria ratified CEDAW: Yes (8 February 1982)
